body_content.explanation: to move air or something else into and out of the lungs:
examples: The doctor told me to breathe in and hold it for three seconds.
Breathing in just a small amount of the gas can cause serious damage.
The instructor told us to take a deep breath and then breathe out slowly.
The man at the next table was breathing out smoke through his nostrils.
It's so airless in here - I can hardly breathe.
I'm sorry if I'm breathing (= blowing out air containing) garlic fumes all over you!

body_content.explanation: If you allow wine to breathe, you open the bottle for a short time before you drink from it, in order to improve the wine's flavour.
